intro: Phyteuma gallicum, commonly known as the French bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodland and meadows, preferring well-drained soil. It produces showy flowers from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice in gardens and conservation efforts.
